defs: the sound of a sudden and loud laugh.

the opening at the lower end of the alimentary canal, through which the solid refuse of digestion is excreted; the anus.

any of pale-coloured social insects of Isoptera order, having a soft body and living in colonies composed of winged forms that mate and wingless workers and soldiers that are usu. sterile or immature, and which are very destructive to wooden structures and are found in the temperate zones and esp. in the tropics; a white ant; a termite.

heaven or the celestial regions.
the planet that we live on; the earth.
a natural raised part of the earth's surface, usu. rising more or less abruptly; a hill or mountain.
a woody perennial plant with one main stem or trunk which develops many branches, usu. at some height above the ground; a tree.
water.
a ridge or swell moving along the surface of a liquid or body of water as a result of disturbance, as by wind; a wave.
any of a class (Aves) of warmblooded, two-legged, egg-laying vertebrates with feathers and wings; a bird.

any of several gallinaceous birds of the genera Pavo, the male of which is distinguished by its long, erectile, greenish, iridescent tail coverts that are brilliantly marked with ocellated spots and that can be spread in a fan; the pea-fowl.

something that is spoken; an utterance; a speech.
the organ of sight; the eye.

hair growing on the body.

one of the bony, permanent, hollow paired growths, often curved and pointed, that project from the upper part of the head of certain ungulate mammals, as cattle, sheep, goats, antelopes, etc.; a horn.
the region of any of the principal points of the compass or divisions of the horizon; a quarter or direction.
a slender, straight, usu. pointed, missile to be shot from a bow and equipped with feathers at the end of the shaft near the nock, for controlling flight; an arrow.

that is large in size, rough, harsh, etc.

a necklace of two, four or thirty-four strings.
(gen.) a gate in gen.
the main gate of a town.

a structure that is relatively high for its length and width and of conical or pyramidal type standing on the main gate of a town or temple or on the sanctum sanctorum of a temple or on a palace building.
the grass Cyperus rotundus ( = C. hexastachyus) of Cyperaceae family; sedge.
a metal structure, with a handle, on which the votive lamps are fixed in a pyramidal fashion, for waiving before a deity.
the act or an instance of waiving such votive lamps.
to intertwine a several strings of different colour, to make a thread or rope.
a pit in the groundfor burying a dead body; a burial pit; a grave.
a secret place.
that is to be kept or meant to be secret.
something known only to a certain person or persons and purposely or meant to be a thing kept or meant to be kept secret.
the son of a maid or female-slave.
the act of hiding, concealing something.
(rhet.) the writing in a style in which the meaning or intention is kept as suggestive rather than explicit.
a maintaining of a secret.
a giving of a cow as a gift.
the excrement of a cow; cow-dung.
a washing of the floor with water mixed with cow-dung.
(loosely) a washing of the floor where one has taken one's meal; ಗೋಮಹಚ್ಚು gōma haccu to wash the floor where one has taken one's meal.
a herd of cows.
the entire earth.
= ಗೋಮಂಡಲ.
the owner of a cow-herd.
the plant Eriolaena candollei of Sterculiaceae family.
a man with pleasing appearance; a handsome man.
(Jain.) Bāhubali, one of the Kāmadēvas.
the colossus of Bāhubali; installed on the hills of Śravaṇa Beḷagoḷa, in Karnāṭaka, in the tenth century A.D.
an idol, icon.
(fig.) an ideal or distinguished person or thing.
a tractable or excellent cow.
the excrement of a cow; cow-dung.
a kind of wild dogs, mostly yellowish-grey and smaller than the wolf, which hunt prey in packs, gen. at night, and also eat carrion; a jackal.
a kind of frog.
an acute, highly contagious viral disease of cattle, characterised by fever and by blisters in the mouth and around the hoofs; the foot-and-mouth disease.
the sugarcane Saccharum spontaneum of Poaceae family.
a piece of land set aside for pasturing; pasture-land.
the portion of the body that joins the head the body; the neck.
the respiratory tract or oesophagus; the wind-pipe or food-tube.
a man owning a lot of cows; a herd-owner.
the tree Psidium guajava ( = P. pyriferum) of Myrtaceae family; guava tree.
its edible fruit.
Lakṣmi, the Goddess of wealth.
the earth (personified as a woman).
a kind of centipede of the Chilopoda class, having an elongated, flattened body composed several segments, each with a pair of legs.
a conspicuous line of reversed hair, resembling a centipede, on the body of a horse, considered as a blemish.
(gen.) lack of something necessary for completeness or an imperfection or weakness; deficiency; a fault, flaw, blemish.
a hypocritical action, deceptive appearance, etc. ; sham; pretence.
the face of a cow.
a vessel with a snout for serving liquid foods.
the base, in the shape of a platter, for the idol of a deity, having a channel for the water and other liquids with which the idol is washed, flow out.
the act of anointing unguents.
a kind of musical instrument.
a man given to the habit of drinking liquors.
a hole, breach or chasm.
a wicked person pretending to be a pious, kind, virtuous; a wolf in sheep's clothing.
a channel in the base structure for the water or other liquids with which the idol (kept on it) is washed flow out.
a particular type of body posture, either as a part of physical exercise or for meditation.
a small, pouch, shaped like a cow's mouth, for covering the hand while telling beads.
= ಗೋಮುಳ್ಳು.
the plant Rubus idaeus of Rosaceae family; raspberry.
its small, juicy, edible fruit; raspberry.
another plant of the same family, Rubus niveus ( = R. lasiocarpus).
the urine of cattle.
the zigzag mark on the ground made by the urine passed out by a cow while walking.
a particular stance or manner of striking in mace-fight.
a type of verse the second of which repeats nearly all the syllables of the first.

a silicate of zirconium, ZrSiO4, a mineral found in igneous and sedimentary rocks and occurring in tetragonal crystals coloured yellow, brown, red, etc., transparent varieties of which are used as gems; zircon.
